body_html:
Thanks for the report, I'll update the link (the correct link is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/java/README.md)

That said, looking at your erro message it seems that ti cannot find the native library. Can do run the following commands to help verify what might be missing in your setup?

ls ~/jni
file ~/jni/*

Alternatively, if it makes sense for you, I'd suggest using a build tool like maven or gradle or something as that will involve much less command-line tweaking. See instructions on the website for maven, or if you use other build tools (like gradle), then see the corresponding dependency information section here

body:
Thanks for the report, I'll update the link (the correct link is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/java/README.md)

That said, looking at your erro message it seems that ti cannot find the native library. Can do run the following commands to help verify what might be missing in your setup?

```
ls ~/jni
file ~/jni/*
```

Alternatively, if it makes sense for you, I'd suggest using a build tool like maven or gradle or something as that will involve much less command-line tweaking. See [instructions on the website](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_java#using_tensorflow_with_a_maven_project) for maven, or if you use other build tools (like gradle), then see the corresponding dependency information section [here](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Corg.tensorflow%7Ctensorflow%7C1.2.0%7C)
